definition: to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: I used to practice Joycean sentences and punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 我过去常常练习乔伊斯式的句子和断句方式。

sentences.english: The key strokes to split inputted string.
sentences.chinese: 用来对所输入字串断句的按键。

sentences.english: The reasons are the misunderstandings to some related words caused by punctuation by the editors.
sentences.chinese: 究其原因，应该是断句者对相关词语的理解偏误所致。

definition: pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
to rhyme/sometimes written 壓韻|压韵
level and oblique tones (technical term for Classical Chinese rhythmic poetry)
context/the surrounding words/same as 上下文
inversion (rhetoric device of inverting the word order for heightened effect)/anastrophe
